evidence_extraction:
```json
[
  "Unless Title Three is put in this bill, there's nothing to protect the young children and old women who must face police dogs and fire hoses in the South while they engage in peaceful demonstrations.",
  "We are tired of being beaten by policemen. We are tired of seeing our people locked up in jails over and over again.",
  "All of the forces of Eastland, Barnett, Wallace, and Thurmond will not stop this revolution!",
  "It will not protect the citizens of Danville, Virginia, who must live in constant fear of a police state.",
  "We need a bill to ensure the equality of a maid who earns five dollars a week in the home of a family whose total income is one hundred thousand dollars a year.",
  "But we will march with the spirit of love and with the spirit of dignity that we have shown here today.",
  "The speech uses direct factual accounts and calls to action rather than deceptive framing. No evidence found for manipulation.",
  "The speaker's appeals are based on evident suffering and verifiable injustices, not strategic distortion.",
  "There is no indication of intent to mislead or exploit emotions in a deceptive manner within the text.",
  "Unless Title Three is put in this bill, there's nothing to protect the young children and old women who must face police dogs and fire hoses in the South...",
  "Do you know that in Albany, Georgia, nine of our leaders have been indicted, not by Dixiecrats, but by the federal government for peaceful protest?",
  "What did the federal government do when Albany police deputies beat Attorney C.B. King and left him half-dead? What did the federal government do when local police officials kicked and assaulted the pregnant wife of Slater King, and she lost her baby?",
  "Unless Title Three is put in this bill, there's nothing to protect the young children and old women who must face police dogs and fire hoses in the South while they engage in peaceful demonstrations.",
  "American politics is dominated by politicians who build their careers on immoral compromises and ally themselves with open forms of political, economic, and social exploitation.",
  "We are tired! We are tired of being beaten by policemen. We are tired of seeing our people locked up in jails over and over again.",
  "We need a bill to ensure the equality of a maid who earns five dollars a week in the home of a family whose total income is one hundred thousand dollars a year. We must have a good FEPC bill.",
  "Where is the political party that will make it unnecessary to march on Washington? Where is the political party that will make it unnecessary to march in the streets of Birmingham? Where is the political party that will protect the citizens of Albany, Georgia?",
  "we shall splinter the segregated South into a thousand pieces and put them together in the image of God and democracy.",
  "nothing to protect the young children and old women who must face police dogs and fire hoses in the South",
  "citizens of Danville, Virginia, who must live in constant fear of a police state.",
  "What about the three young men - SNCC field secretaries in Americus, Georgia - who face the death penalty for engaging in peaceful protest?",
  "We do not want our freedom gradually, but we want to be free now!",
  "I appeal to all of you to get in this great revolution that is sweeping this nation. Get in and stay in the streets of every city, every village and hamlet of this nation until true freedom comes, until the revolution of 1776 is complete.",
  "By the forces of our demands, our determination, and our numbers, we shall splinter the segregated South into a thousand pieces and put them together in the image of God and democracy.",
  "The speech acknowledges the 'serious social revolution' and the need for sustained direct action, implying an understanding of the arduous path to change, not oversimplified solutions.",
  "The call for 'freedom now' and the vision of a 'revolution' are ambitious but framed as urgent necessities and hard-won goals, not magical thinking.",
  "There is no denial of complexity or unrealistic promises of effortless change; rather, the speaker prepares the audience for struggle ('we will go to jail').",
  "Unless Title Three is put in this bill, there's nothing to protect the young children and old women who must face police dogs and fire hoses in the South...",
  "We must have legislation that will protect the Mississippi sharecropper who is put off of his farm because he dares to register to vote. We need a bill that will provide for the homeless and starving people of this nation.",
  "If we do not get meaningful legislation out of this Congress, the time will come when we will not confine our marching to Washington."
]
```
